prop.head.label.name: Chapter
prop.head.headtext: Legal Bases Used by the Courts for the Protection of Confidential Business Information

para.paratext: Use of the sui generis theory provides the courts with the flexibility to deal with the rights of the parties without the necessity of complying with the precedents established in property, contract or equity. However, it is difficult to disassociate the basis of the right to confidential business information from the origins of confidential information arising out of a long line of historical precedent. The desire for consistency and predictability in the treatment of confidential information would seem to favour the treatment of confidential business information as a property right.
